abstract: As Barry Diller pares down IAC/InterActiveCorp, the remaining company’s coffers will get a lot fatter with a new $3.5 billion five-year advertising deal with Google.
snippet: As Barry Diller pares down IAC/InterActiveCorp, the remaining company’s coffers will get a lot fatter with a new $3.5 billion five-year advertising deal with Google.
lead_paragraph: Barry Diller does have a nose for deals. He’s usually not real early on a trend, but he’s not that late either. Take Ask Jeeves, which his company, IAC/InterActiveCorp bought in 2005 for $1.85 billion.

headline.main: Barry Diller Asks and Google Answers With Cash

abstract: Google said Monday that it is leading a broad industry effort to develop new software technologies aimed at turning cellphones into powerful mobile computers.
snippet: Google said Monday that it is leading a broad industry effort to develop new software technologies aimed at turning cellphones into powerful mobile computers.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5 — What Apple began with its iPhone, Google is hoping to accelerate, with an ambitious plan to transform the software at the heart of cellphones.

headline.print_headline: Google Is Pursuing Plans to Put a PC Into Every Pocket

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and John Markoff

abstract: While helping transfer money into an elementary school lunch money system, eBay’s PayPal shows that it is more interested in cutting its costs than helping users, thereby ceding some of its franchise to Google Checkout.
snippet: While helping transfer money into an elementary school lunch money system, eBay’s PayPal shows that it is more interested in cutting its costs than helping users, thereby ceding some of its franchise to Google Checkout.
lead_paragraph: It’s not easy competing with Google. But a few minutes trying to buy my daughters their school lunches showed me why I think eBay’s PayPal will lose ground to Google Checkout.

headline.main: PayPal is Rude in the Lunch Line
